content.text:
# John Wallis (MP for King's Lynn)

John Wallis (c.1567–1633)  was an English merchant and politician who sat in the House of Commons from 1621 to 1624.
Wallis was a merchant of King's Lynn and is recorded in 1601 as purchasing a boat for £80.  He became mayor of King's Lynn in 1622 after Thomas Snelling the holder of the office died.  In 1624 he was re-elected MP for King's Lynn.[https://archive.org/details/bub_gb_5V09AAAAYAAJ  Browne Willis Notitia parliamentaria, or, An history of the counties, cities, and boroughs in England and Wales: ... The whole extracted from mss. and printed evidences 1750 pp176-239] He was mayor of King's Lynn again in 1631.
